perturbation.original_text: 4.2 Royalty Fee. We will receive all Commissions (defined below) from insurance carriers. We will receive all Premiums (defined below), Policy Fees (defined below) and Agency Fees on your behalf. If the event that any Premiums, Policy Fees, or Agency Fees are received directly by you, these funds must be forwarded to us within twenty four (24) hours of receipt. We will retain Agency Fees and will forward Premiums and Policy Fees to the insurance carriers. Beginning on the date you begin operations under this Agreement, which is agreed to be the date set out in the Declarations Page (the "Commencement Date"), we will remit to you Net Revenues on a monthly basis.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.2 Royalty Fee. We will receive all Commissions (defined below) from insurance carriers. We will receive all Premiums (defined below), Policy Fees (defined below) and Agency Fees on your behalf. If the event that any Premiums, Policy Fees, or Agency Fees are received directly by you, these funds must be forwarded to us within seventy two (72) hours of receipt. We will retain Agency Fees and will forward Premiums and Policy Fees to the insurance carriers. Beginning on the date you begin operations under this Agreement, which is agreed to be the date set out in the Declarations Page (the "Commencement Date"), we will remit to you Net Revenues within 45 days.
perturbation.explanation: The original text requires the franchisee to forward any premiums, policy fees, or agency fees within 24 hours of receipt. By modifying this to 72 hours, it contradicts laws in certain jurisdictions that may require faster remittance, especially when dealing with trust accounts or client funds. Changing the remittance of net revenues to 45 days contradicts the monthly payment schedule.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State laws regarding handling of client funds and payment schedules.

perturbation.original_text: 5.1 Opening Deadline. You are responsible for purchasing, leasing, or subleasing a suitable site for the Franchised Business. You agree to establish the Franchised Business and have it open and in operation within six (6) months after the Effective Date of this Agreement. Time is of the essence.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.1 Opening Deadline. You are responsible for purchasing, leasing, or subleasing a suitable site for the Franchised Business. You agree to establish the Franchised Business and have it open and in operation within three (3) months after the Effective Date of this Agreement. Time is of the essence.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the opening deadline to three months might contradict laws that grant franchisees a reasonable time to establish their business, considering the complexities involved in site selection, construction, and regulatory compliance. This shorter timeframe introduces non-compliance with standards deemed reasonable under franchise law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Franchise laws that define a reasonable period for business establishment.

perturbation.original_text: 15.3 Notices to us. In the event of cancellation, material change, or non-renewal of any policy, sixty (60) days' advance written notice must be provided to us in the manner provided in Section 24 below.
perturbation.changed_text: 15.3 Notices to us. In the event of cancellation, material change, or non-renewal of any policy, thirty (30) days' advance written notice must be provided to us in the manner provided in Section 24 below.
perturbation.explanation: Reducing the notice period for policy changes to 30 days may conflict with state insurance regulations that mandate longer notice periods for cancellations or significant changes, thereby creating non-compliance with regulatory standards.
perturbation.contradicted_law: State insurance laws mandating notice periods for policy changes.
